newsitem.title: UK: UK's BIFU to join in Barclays staff action.
newsitem.headline: UK's BIFU to join in Barclays staff action.

text.p: The Banking Insurance and Finance Union (BIFU), one of the unions representing UK's banking and finance workers, said it would co-ordinate with another union UNiFI in industrial action at Barclays Plc in a dispute linked to performance-linked pay.
UNiFI had announced earlier on Monday that it would go ahead with industrial action after the bank broke off talks with it and BIFU.
Talks broke down after just two days, when the bank refused to refer a pay-and-grading structure dispute to the British government industrial relations arbitration service ACAS.
BIFU, which represents several thousand employees in the bank, had earlier voted for strike action.
Both BIFU and UNiFI are likely to pursue the overtime ban to force Barclays to modify their current plans for introducing performance pay.

No date for a start of the industrial action has yet been announced but it is expected to include work to rule, withdrawal of co-operation from implementation, operation of performance management, overtime ban and working strictly to contracted hours.
